text:
Hi, I've got a couple more issues.
```fig, ax, plotobject = lines(-60:0.1:800, LACT_rel,
                        color = :red,
                        linewidth = 2, alpha = 0.1)
plotobject.alpha = 0.1```
Both of these methods aren't changing `alpha`.

Also, `limits!`  works, but `ylims!` gives `UndefVarError: ylims! not defined`, despite showing up in the pulldown when typing y.  Same issue with `xlims!` Is there a bug with `y\xlims!`?

text: There is no alpha parameter, but you can set the color to (:red, 0.1)

elements.text: There is no alpha parameter, but you can set the color to (:red, 0.1)

text: Weird with the ylims!, can you try MakieLayout.ylims!? Maybe we have a conflict there or something with an AbstractPlotting and MakieLayout function
